cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible at the port beginning late Friday night and lingering into Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: In Cameron Parish and adjacent portions of the Lake Charles district, 1–2 ft of surge above normally dry ground is possible, mainly Friday night through early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain with localized totals of 4–6 inches may cause flash and urban flooding around the Lake Charles Harbor District.
weather_observation.other_hazards: An isolated tornado cannot be ruled out in the broader region, but the immediate port risk is low.
